abstract: The Australian gas company Arrow Energy agreed on Monday to accept a sweetened 3.5 billion Australian dollar bid by Shell and PetroChina for its Australian assets, the latest in a string of acquisitions and investments in the global energy sector.
snippet: The Australian gas company Arrow Energy agreed on Monday to accept a sweetened 3.5 billion Australian dollar bid by Shell and PetroChina for its Australian assets, the latest in a string of acquisitions and investments in the global energy sector.
lead_paragraph: Arrow Energy, the Australian gas company, agreed on Monday to accept a sweetened 3.5 billion Australian dollar bid by Shell and PetroChina for its Australian assets, the latest in a string of acquisitions and investments in the global energy sector, Bettina Wassener reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Arrow Agrees to Sell Assets to PetroChina and Shell
